image.altText: Gallagher, tehan faruqi graphic

props.synopsis: The Senate has rejected the government's bid to rush extraordinary immigration powers through the parliament.

title.children: Senate blocks government's attempt to rush extraordinary immigration powers through parliament

image.altText: A small motorboat in front of a collapsed bridge with a large container ship underneath it

props.synopsis: A search for six roadworkers who were on a bridge that was brought down by an out-of-control container ship in the US city of Baltimore has been suspended until tomorrow morning.

title.children: 'We've gotta stop all traffic': Mayday call before US bridge collapse 'saved lives', but six workers presumed dead

image.altText: Imaging shows the SS Lake Illawarra and Tasman Bridge pylons.

props.synopsis: Memories of the fatal event that split Tasmania's capital city in two have been triggered as rescue efforts continue in Baltimore. Maritime workers reflect on lessons learnt from the 1975 tragedy.

title.children: Reminders of Australia's own bridge catastrophe still sit on Hobart's riverbed

image.altText: A horse looks into a camera.

props.synopsis: The RSPCA is investigating after three emaciated thoroughbred horses were found on a property in southern Tasmania — animals which were once owned by Tasmania's former attorney-general Vanessa Goodwin.

title.children: Heartbreak, anger on social media over horses once owned by former Tasmanian attorney-general

image.altText: Rebecca White election night March 23, 2024

props.synopsis: After a third straight election defeat, Rebecca White's decision to step down as Tasmanian Labor party leader hardly came as a surprise.

title.children: White says resigning was by choice, but was conceding the Tasmanian election her call?

image.altText: SITG2023_CROWD_@RUBYBOLAND_HIGHRES6 (1)

props.synopsis: The annual festival at the North Byron Parklands has pulled the plug on its 2024 edition.

title.children: Splendour In The Grass cancelled for 2024

image.altText: A glass of milk and coffee cups nearby.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian dairy producer is partnering with a seaweed company to bring a milk to the market that is better for the environment, because the cows produce less methane.

title.children: Milk from cows that burp less is better for the environment. Would you pay slightly more for it?

image.altText: Melbourne fans wave flags at the Round 2 AFLW match between Collingwood and Melbourne at Victoria Park.

props.synopsis: The AFL has defended its illicit drugs policy after claims made by federal MP Andrew Wilkie that Melbourne Football Club players were subjected to off-the-books drug tests to help them avoid failing tests on match days.

title.children: AFL defends illicit drugs policy after claims of off-the-books drug tests by federal MP

image.altText: oneil patterson

props.synopsis: In a hastily-convened, late-night Senate hearing, the Coalition and the Greens joined forces to delay the bill until May, frustrating the government's desire for swift passage and opening up weeks of deliberation.

title.children: The government's 'urgent' migration bill has been parked, but questions remain

image.altText: Cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: The annual rate of inflation remained steady in February, at 3.4 per cent, while underlying inflation picked up slightly, to 3.9 per cent.

title.children: The annual rate of inflation remained steady in February, at 3.4 per cent

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair sits on a pink couch and looks into the distance.

props.synopsis: Legitimately registered Australian companies are being used to shift scam victims' money overseas and it's proving a challenge for authorities trying to figure out who's responsible.

title.children: After Jo lost $500k through an Australian company, she thought it would be easy to track down. She was wrong

image.altText: Photo illustration of Peter Cullen Macarthur etched in the right-hand side of the screen and school books to the left

props.synopsis: Convicted sex offender Peter Cullen Macarthur was part of the peak body that investigated a Cranbrook teacher who was accused of sending sexually explicit emails to a former student.

title.children: Body that investigated Cranbrook teacher's explicit emails had convicted child sex offender on its board

image.altText: A woman looks out in an empty room with concrete walls.

props.synopsis: Almost 200 people entered a ballot to live in this build-to-rent development — six years in the making — in one of Sydney's most sought-after suburbs.

title.children: Single mother Karen embraces new 'micro' living in Sydney's inner west, saving $300 a week on rent

image.altText: A person in scientific clothes looks at a crashed police car.

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old man was taken to the Cairns Base Hospital where he is currently being assessed.

title.children: Police shoot man in Far North Queensland after alleged theft of police car

image.altText: Katy Gallagher

props.synopsis: Finance Minister Katy Gallagher has launched an attack on the Coalition in the Senate over its support of The Greens moving to delay changes to Australia's immigration law. Follow live.

title.children: 'This is on your heads': Government accuses Coalition of derailing immigration changes

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Sussan Ley asks Clare O'Neil another question
NSW calls for more federal schools funding

image.altText: a man smiling in front of a painting smiling

props.synopsis: Indigenous Australian art is celebrated globally. But who reaps the profits? Indigenous Australians are advised that this story contains the images and names of people who have died.

title.children: This late artist's egg-blue canvas sold for nearly $200,000 in New York. Back home, his family received nothing from the sale

image.altText: Rubble of a home burnt to the ground in bushfires with an orange and yellow glow in the air around

props.synopsis: The NSW state coroner hands down her findings and recommendations after a two-year series of inquests and inquiries into the 2019-20 bushfire season that killed 25 people in NSW .

title.children: Residents angered and disappointed by inquiry recommendations into fatal Black Summer bushfires

image.altText: A composite image of Peter FitSimons, wearing a red bandana, and Bruce Lehrmann in a suit and tie, wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Peter FitzSimons was made to produce material during Mr Lehrmann's defamation case. In an application lodged earlier this month, he's now seeking costs over the matter.

title.children: Journalist Peter FitzSimons seeking costs from Bruce Lehrmann over defamation case

image.altText: Indonesian elementary school students attend a class in an unfinished class room.

props.synopsis: The worsening effects of climate change are pushing female students in Asia out of the classroom, with extreme droughts and heavy flooding hamstringing their ability to fulfil household duties, maintain good hygiene, and even physically get to school.

title.children: Climate change forces female students out of the classroom

image.altText: People walking in Brisbane's Queen Street Mall

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has ticked up slightly after a flat start to the day, while the latest monthly inflation data for February showed the annual rate remained steady at 3.4 per cent. Follow live.

title.children: Inflation remains steady in February for third-straight month, Australian share market higher after Wall Street sinks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Increase to minimum wage 'should not exceed' 2.8pc, Ai Group says
Can we still expect interest rate cuts in September?
Splendour in the Grass cancels 2024 festival

image.altText: Two hands holding a poster with a picture of a man on it with his mouth covered and the words "Free Assange"

props.synopsis: Julian Assange's supporters have described his ongoing incarceration as "punishment by process", but as his legal bids to avoid extradition to the United States drag on in Britain's legal system, a political solution could be the answer to ending the years-long saga.

title.children: Another day, another delay for Julian Assange's legal saga — this is why a political solution is in play

image.altText: A close up photo of Chelsea looking serious.

props.synopsis: Chelsea Sirolli claims she was fired two days into a new job after her employers learned of her history in the sex industry.

title.children: Chelsea was involved in the sex industry a decade ago, and she says she's been fired over it three times

image.altText: Girl wearing colourful bathers and red swimming cap mid-freestyle stroke in a pool.

props.synopsis: Extracurricular activities such as sport and music have amazing benefits in the right doses but researchers say over-scheduling them can hurt teenagers' sleep and mental health.

title.children: Is your teen too busy? Here's why it matters

image.altText: A small lamb sitting in an icecream tub being weighed

props.synopsis: A South Australian hobby farmer has had an early Easter gift with tiny sextuplet lambs born on his property. While triplets are common, this has been described as an "amazing feat".

title.children: Hobby farmer stunned after ewe gives birth to six lambs in incredibly rare event

image.altText: Older woman with green shirt and short white hair and glasses, sits in outdoor setting smiling with mouth closed.

props.synopsis: Experts argue the aged care system isn't adequately addressing elderly residents' mental health, but that government-funded sessions with a psychologist could help them feel happier and more at ease.

title.children: Half of all Australians in nursing homes experience depression. These experts say there's a simple solution to that

image.altText: The doors of the Todd Tavern are seen smashed.

props.synopsis: The Alice Springs mayor is calling for federal intervention after a prominent local pub was attacked and widespread unrest broke out in the town on Tuesday.

title.children: Scenes of rioting, violence trigger calls for federal response to unrest in Alice Springs

image.altText: A selfie of a young Asian woman near the water. She is looking directly into the camera.

props.synopsis: Women who are of working age make up the vast majority of almost five million Australians afflicted with migraine. Yet experts say many are needlessly suffering and it is ruining their careers and quality of life.

title.children: Chronic migraine attacks stole 17 years of Natalie's life. One injection gave her life back to her

image.altText: A woman with her head in her hand in front of a computer screen.

props.synopsis: 'High functioning' can be a loaded term but in relation to anxiety, a clinical psychologist says it's use can have positive outcomes.

title.children: You’re achieving your goals, but are you enjoying it? It might be time to talk about anxiety

image.altText: Humanitarian aid attached to parachutes floating over Gaza.

props.synopsis: Israel has recalled its ceasefire negotiators from Qatar, after deeming mediated talks on a Gaza truce "at a dead end", a senior Israeli official says.

title.children: Palestinians reportedly drown reaching aid, as Israel says truce talks at 'dead end'

image.altText: a large LNG ship in a harbour.

props.synopsis: Australia is one of the world's biggest gas exporters, yet is poised to start importing supplies from overseas. It's a situation that's drawn despair and surprise in equal measure.

title.children: Gas-rich Australia's looming need for LNG imports labelled 'bizarre' and nonsensical

image.altText: A man stands near his ute with his hands crossed

props.synopsis: Keith Tunney has shared his farmland in WA with energy companies for nearly 30 years, but he feels ignored by the latest owner of oil and gas wells on his farm — so he locked his gates.

title.children: Farmer locks gate, slams Japanese energy company for 'disrespectful' treatment
